title: Less than 0.5% of players played Dominion
body:
There's probably 10 threads on the front page right now complaining about its removal.  Everyone claims they played tons of Dominion.

Ok.

UPDATE: The front page is no longer clogged up with threads about Dominion.  At the time of posting, a few hours after the announcement, there actually were somewhere between 10 and 15 threads complaining.  Hopefully this clears up any misunderstandings.

replies.body:
I think people are more annoyed with the fact that Riot barely even tried to care for the map at all. 

People stopped playing/caring dominion because riot stopped balancing it around like season 3. (As far as I remember anyways, correct me if I'm wrong please)

There was little to no reason to even try playing the game mode when riot barely did anything about bots in the mode and ignored it anyways.

I'd agree that Riot's treatment of Dominion was garbage, don't get me wrong.  I'm just baffled by how many people are coming out of the woodwork and flipping their shit over a game mode they never played.

> [{quoted}](name=Zenthon127,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JyH8AeYP,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-02-11T01:35:20.250+0000)
>
> I'd agree that Riot's treatment of Dominion was garbage, don't get me wrong.  I'm just baffled by how many people are coming out of the woodwork and flipping their shit over a game mode they never played.

I honestly feel like people do care about Dominion, but they just had no incentive to play it over Summoner's Rift. 

I'll be honest I only played dominion like 3/4 times this year, and to be fair, that's probably more than I played it last year. 
It's just disappointing to see Riot do away with the game mode when it feels like they could really do something with it. 

That being said, I think we all knew this would happen eventually, even if some of us didn't want it to.

I used to play it a lot actually. Haven't since late season 2, just didn't seem fun to me anymore. I really don't care if it stays or goes since I personally don't get any enjoyment from it.

But I know there are those who did, and I can't help but wonder why Riot is removing it. There's no reason unless it was drawing excessive resources from SR.

You also have to consider the precedent this sets. Now Riot can look at something unpopular about League, and just remove it. Rather than putting in the effort to save it, they can just do away with it. How long before Twisted Treeline gets the trigger pulled on it? Is ARAM popular enough to save it from being put down? Will season 7 be the time when all we have left to choose from is SR and custom games that take place on SR?

That's a horrifying thought, and yesterday I'd have called you crazy for suggesting it. Now, I'm having serious doubts. Players really do not like this "nobody plays it, time to get rid of it" philosophy. What if they decided to do that with champions? Galio would be the first to go. Urgot a close second.

Players aren't just angry at the removal of a game mode, they're mad at the idea behind it and what if could mean for the future.

That's some serious slippery slope thinking.

Besides, they already do it with champions.  It's called a full rework.

Why on Earth would they remove ARAM? That game mode was solely created due to its popularity, it's (afaik) the second game mode before TT nowadays and it has a highly stable playerbase.

Dominion wasn't "unpopular". It was a huge fail that attracted no one after a few games, took a lot of resources to maintain minimally balanced and was populated by farm bots.

Hell, it was more of a joke than a game mode. You just needed to mention "Dominion" in any forum and any answer you'd get were jokes like "Is that the new champion?"

I'm sorry for those humans at /r/totallynotrobots that enjoyed Dominion, but I see nothing wrong on removing the biggest fail in this game.

To be fair, a lot of the people 'coming out of the woodwork' are probably legitimately concerned. 0.5% of players who had access, even 0.1%, is still a lot of people. I can 100% believe that there's 50 or so people that would come to the boards on such a big event, and I've gotta imagine almost literally every active hardcore Dominion player is posting.

does the .5% include the people who play customs?

A lot of people have fond memories of hide n seek, that's the main reason why I don't want dominion to go

Because at least part of the reason nobody plays is because Riot didn't put time and effort into it. They promised various features at launch, yet dropped the map three months later.

If we go by Riot's numbers on their website, in 2014, 27 million people play at least 1 league game a day. I would consider that an active player. So, .5% of that is...135,000 players. So lets say 15% of those players were bots. That leaves roughly 115,000 dominion players. This minority becoming vocal on the forums would explain the rise in "I played dominion" threads if even a small fraction of these 115,000 dominion players decided to complain.

But then that people would be scattered over lots of mediums, like other boards or maybe no site at all.

This reduces the presence here even further.

I have no doubt that some of the dominion complainers are phonies, but the population is large enough that even if it's spread over the two largest League forums (here and reddit) there's still thousands of legit dominion players. Enough to get noticed on either site.

I bet 90% of them haven't played Dominion in months/years, but as soon as something is going, they said they love it and will play it then when they riot decide to keep Dominion, they won't touch the mode again.

I played Dominate Dominion back when it didn't conflict with my work schedule. I still played it occasionally when I was tired of SR. I would by lying to claim it was my dominate mode though.

As for the 0.5% of the player base, lets just low ball some numbers. League has one-million active players; 0.25% of the community plays dominion and isn't a bot. That would mean Dominion has 2 500 active players. While a fractionally small part of the player base, that's still a lot of people.
As for why they're posting now: Riot had an unofficial unspoken policy about ignoring dominion. There was no incentive to speak up before.

Also worth noting, Dominion wasn't launched outside NA and EU. So it's safe to say, all the affected persons are using the English forums.

And? You said it yourself, the percentage of people who play Dominion is amazingly fractionally small. I'm pretty sure if Riot pulled up a pie chart of their entire active playerbase and cut out the Dominion players, then cut the ACTUAL Dominion players out of that, the slice would be so small you couldn't even see it. No sane company would try to devote a huge amount of resources (in this case AN ENTIRE MAP) for such a small amount of people, even if they were completely non-profit. 

I'm sorry the game modes you've had fun with for years are going away, I'm not trying to bash that, but from a business perspective WITH PROFIT NOT BEING A FACTOR Riot's completely justified. The amount of upkeep they did to make it worthwhile is sad, but the fact of it is there's just nothing that can be done with it outside of a full blown redevelopment of how Dominion works, with all the problems current Dominion has still there.
